html: John the Revelator, whose mission was similar to Isaiah's, described his vision in the same figurative terms (see Rev. 4:2, 8). In describing John's revelation, the Prophet Joseph Smith told us that the eyes and the wings represent the light and knowledge of God and his power to move and act (see D&C 77:2-4). Isaiah 6:2 and D&C 38:1 undoubtedly refer to the angelic hosts of heaven (the suffix im is plural masculine in the Hebrew). Rev. 15:8 identifies the smoke which filled the house as being from the glory of God.
